goal.ch: The core subject of this course is Edward Yang’s cinema, in particular its themes, cinematic styles, and philosophy. Issues explored include the Taiwan New Waves, geopolitics, globalization, identity, sex and gender differences, mediation, and such notions as death, life, and art. Taiwan’s socio-political and cultural contexts, Edward Yang’s intellectual background, his contemorary film makers, and influences on his films will be considered. The course offers methods of both close-reading of the cinematic texts and a survey of critical theory so that they illuminate each other. As students acquire basic techniques to approach Edward Yang’s filmic texts as well as understand relevant contemporary philosophical thoughts, they will be able to apply the same methodology to other visual materials.

gradMethod.ch:
1. 平時出席及課堂表現：40％ （導讀，課堂參與，課上提問。）
2. 期中口頭及書面報告：20％（書面報告中文3000字以上丶或英文1500字以上，為期末報告雛形，不含註釋及參考書目；期中口頭報告10分鐘。）
3. 期末口頭及書面報告：40％（書面報告10,000字以上丶或英文5,000字以上，不含註釋及參考書目；期末口頭報告15分鐘。）
1. Attendance and tutorial: 40％ (Guided reading and discussion.)
2. Mid-term Presentation and Essay: 20％ (Word length: No less than 3000 words in Chinese or 1500 words in English, bibliography not included; Presentation: 10 minutes max.)
3. Final Presentation and Essay: 40％ (Word length: No less than 10,000 words in Chinese or 5,000 words in English, bibliography not included; Presentation: 15 minutes max.)
